metadata.comment: The date of this hour of aggregated data.
$org_id_default_description
The driver or vehicle id of this hour of aggregated data.
The type of object this data is aggregated for (1 if vehicle, 5 if driver).
The starting timestamp of this hourly interval.
The ending timestamp of this hourly interval.
The amount of fuel consumed in milliliters for this hour of aggregated data after filtering out impossibly high fuel efficiency.
The amount of fuel consumed in milliliters for this hour of aggregated data before filtering out impossibly high fuel efficiency.
The amount of energy consumed in kilowatt-hours for this hour of aggregated data after filtering out impossible high energy efficiency.
The amount of energy consumed in kilowatt-hours for this hour of aggregated data before filtering out impossible high energy efficiency.
The distance traveled in meters for this hour of aggregated data after filtering out impossibly high fuel/energy efficiency.
The distance traveled in meters for this hour of aggregated data before filtering out impossibly high fuel/energy efficiency.

The GPS distance traveled in meters for this hour of aggregated data after filtering out impossibly high fuel/energy efficiency. This is only reported for historical values from the old monolithic report.

The GPS distance traveled in meters for this hour of aggregated data before filtering out impossibly high fuel/energy efficiency. This is only reported for historical values from the old monolithic report.

The odometer distance traveled in meters for this hour of aggregated data after filtering out impossibly high fuel/energy efficiency. This is only reported for historical values from the old monolithic report.

The odometer distance traveled in meters for this hour of aggregated data before filtering out impossibly high fuel/energy efficiency. This is only reported for historical values from the old monolithic report.
The total cost in US dollars of the fuel consumed in this hour of aggregated data. This cost is derived from an org's custom entered fuel costs.
The total cost in US dollars of the fuel consumed in this hour of aggregated data. This cost is derived from a value pulled from a fuel price API.
The total cost in US dollars of the energy consumed in this hour of aggregated data. This is currently 0 as org's do not have the ability yet to set custom energy costs.
The total cost in US dollars of the energy consumed in this hour of aggregated data. This is derived from a constant cost per kilowatt-hour.
The duration in milliseconds that the engine was on during this hour.
The duration in milliseconds that the engine was idle during this hour.
The duration in milliseconds that auxillary power was being used during idle time in this hour. This is often referred to as productive idle time or PTO (power take-off).
The distance in meters that was traveled via electricity in this hour after filtering out impossibley high energy efficiency.
The distance in meters that was traveled via electricity in this hour before filtering out impossibly high energy efficiency.
The amount of energy regenerated in kilowatt-hours during this hour after filtering out impossibly high energy efficiency. This usually happens via regenerative braking.
The amount of energy regenerated in kilowatt-hours during this hour before filtering out impossibly high energy efficiency. This usually happens via regenerative braking.
